mdRecord.dcterms:title: Staatsburg Library, general view
Saint Margaret of Antioch Church
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: . . . beginning in 1858, services were held in the chapel across the street, now the Staatsburg Library. That building was built by Mrs. Margaret Lewis Livingston, the mother of Mrs. Lydia Hoyt and was used by several religious groups in the village. -- http://www.stmargaretsepiscopalchurch.org/history/ [work]
The Staatsburg Library was used as a Reading Room in 1891 and was granted its first charter by the state of New York in 1894. -- http://staatsburglibrary.org/136-2/ [work]
